title: Distracted Eating: Screens Steal Satiety
description: One-minute skill: Distracted Eating: Screens Steal Satiety.

hook.text: Eating lunch at your desk while scrolling? You'll eat 25% more and remember 50% less of what you ate.

buildup.text: Attention is a limited resource. When it's on a screen, the brain receives fewer signals from the meal.

discovery.text: Memory of eating matters â€” people who can't recall lunch feel hungrier at dinner and eat more.

twist.text: TV-watching eaters also make poorer food choices â€” screens lower cognitive control over impulse decisions.

climax.text: Simply turning off the screen during meals reduces calorie intake without any dieting effort.

punchline.text: If you can't remember eating, your brain won't either.
